required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Rapastinel as Monotherapy in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study of Rapastinel as Monotherapy in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: Naurex, Inc, an affiliate of Allergan plc

clinical_study.source: Naurex, Inc, an affiliate of Allergan plc

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of 225 milligrams (mg) and 450 milligrams (mg) of Rapastinel, compared to placebo in participants with major depressive disorder (MDD).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Business decision to stop the program.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at End of Double-blind Treatment (End of Week 6).
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in MADRS Total Score at 1 Day After First Dose of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: Rapastinel (prefilled syringe, weekly intravenous IV administration).
Rapastinel (prefilled syringe, weekly intravenous IV administration).

intervention.description: Rapastinel (prefilled syringe, weekly intravenous IV administration).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-5) criteria for MDD
- Current major depressive episode of at least 8 weeks and not exceeding 18 months in duration at Visit 1
- Treatment naive in the current episode or have inadequate response to 1-3 antidepressant therapies given at adequate dose and duration in the current episode
- If female of childbearing potential, have a negative serum β-human chorionic gonadotropin (β-hCG) pregnancy test
Exclusion Criteria:
- DSM-5-based diagnosis of any disorder other than MDD that was the primary focus of treatment within 6 months before Visit 1
- Lifetime history of meeting DSM-5 criteria for:
1. Schizophrenia spectrum or other psychotic disorder
2. Bipolar or related disorder
3. Major neurocognitive disorder
4. Neurodevelopmental disorder of greater than mild severity or of a severity that impacts the participant's ability to consent, follow study directions, or otherwise safely participate in the study
5. Dissociative disorder
6. Posttraumatic stress disorder
7. MDD with psychotic features
- Significant suicide risk, as judged by the investigator

facility.name: Okehazama Hospital Fujita Kokoro Care Center
Federal State Budgetary Research Institution "Mental Health Science Center"
Vavrusova Consulting s.r.o. Neštátna Psychiatrická ambulancia
Liptovská nemocnica s poliklinikou MUDr. Ivana Stodolu Liptovský Mikuláš

link.description: Additional information on study locations near you may be found at AllerganClinicalTrials.com. For any study not on AllerganClinicalTrials.com, please contact IR‐CTRegistration@Allergan.com for assistance.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total of 68 participants were screened for eligibility; 50 participants randomized to receive double-blind treatment.

measure.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score at baseline
measure.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement

outcome.title: Change From Baseline on Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at End of Double-blind Treatment (End of Week 6).
outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.
outcome.population: The Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population consisted of all patients in the Safety Population who had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of the MADRS total score.

reported_events.time_frame: The study consisted of a 6 week double-blind treatment period, followed by a 2-week safety follow-up period.
reported_events.desc: Safety Population consists of all randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of randomized investigational product (IP).

group.title: Rapastinel 225mg
group.description: Rapastinel (prefilled syringe, weekly intravenous IV administration).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to study termination, the target number of participants needed to achieve target power and statistically reliable results was not met.
